SEARCH
Package gw.pl.persistence.core

Interface Bundle

All Superinterfaces:
BundleProvider
public interface Bundle extends BundleProvider
EntityBundle maintains a graph of objects for the convenience of application code. Bundles can be used to group together a number of entities for transmission to the server. New entities can be added for insert; they will be assigned a temporary id, which is used by the client constructing the object graph to maintain foreign key relationships. Existing entities can be cloned and added to the bundle. Once all of the desired changes and insertions have been made, the bundle can be unpacked in a single transaction on the server, and all changes committed to the database (see BundleWriter). Temporary ids are converted to real database ids, foreign key relationships are relinked, and objects are inserted in such a way as to avoid violating foreign key constraints.

EntityBundle can also be used to aggregate a graph of objects for transport from the server to the client.

Note that it is the responsibility of the user to maintain the referential integrity of the graph of objects added to the bundle. It is NOT essential that all objects referenced by foreign keys on stored entities be in the bundle; it is perfectly acceptable to add an entity that refers to a number of pre-existing entities that are not in the bundle. A bundle headed for the server should contain only objects that are to be updated or inserted; a bundle headed for the client should contain only objects that the client does not already have. However, all references must be accurate (either to temporary ids handed to inserted objects, or to ids of existing objects), or the attempt to commit the bundle will fail.

Inserted beans are inserted into the database according to a "safe" bean ordering that should prevent any foreign key conflicts. The exception is self-referencing beans (beans that refer to themselves), in which case these beans are still inserted in the order in which they were added to the bundle.

NOTE: this class is not thread safe! It's assumed a single thread is operating on a bundle.

Author:
jseybold, mshaw

    getBundle

  • Method Details

    • add

      <T extends KeyableBean> T add(T bean)
      Determine how to add the bean to the bundle, either for update or insert, or if the bean needs to be added at all?

      If a bean with the same id already exists in the bundle, the already existing bean is evicted and its bundle is set to null when the passed in bean is inserted into the bundle. If this bundle is not writable, associates bean with this bundle if it was previously associated with no bundle, otherwise does nothing.

      Parameters:
      bean - The Keyable entity to store.
      Returns:
      If this bundle is writeable, returns a reference to a KeyableBean with the same ID as the passed-in bean parameter, and which is in the bundle. This may or may not be the same object as the passed-in bean parameter. If this bundle is not writeable, returns the passed-in bean parameter.

    • delete

      KeyableBean delete(KeyableBean bean)
      Add this bean for deletion or retirement. A bean added for update or edit or read will be switched to add for delete. Once a bean is added for delete it cannot be switched to update, edit, or read unless it's first removed from the bundle completely.

      If any foreign keys on other beans in the bundle refer to a temporary id, that's been deleted, then those foreign keys values are set to null

      Parameters:
      bean - Bean to delete or retire

    • remove

      @Deprecated KeyableBean remove(KeyableBean bean)
      Deprecated.
      Use delete(KeyableBean) instead.
      Add this bean for deletion or retirement. A bean added for update or edit or read will be switched to add for delete. Once a bean is added for delete it cannot be switched to update, edit, or read unless it's first removed from the bundle completely.

      If any foreign keys on other beans in the bundle refer to a temporary id, that's been deleted, then those foreign keys values are set to null

      Parameters:
      bean - Bean to delete or retire

    • newBeanInstance

      Bean newBeanInstance(IEntityType type)
      Create a new Bean instance inside this EntityBundle.

      NOTE: This method should be used with caution, as it does not account for required parameters, nor does it respect the intended accessibility of the entity constructor. The preferred method of creating a new Bean is by using the entity constructor, if available, e.g.: 

       Activity activity = new Activity(bundle);
      If no entity constructor is available, then either the entity is abstract and can't be constructed anyway, or else the intended accessibility of the entity constructor is not public.
      Parameters:
      type - the EntityIntrinsicType of the Bean type to create
      Returns:
      a new Bean instance inside this bundle (e.g., this == newBean.getBundle())

    • newBeanInstance

      Bean newBeanInstance(IEntityType type, List<?> requiredValues)
      Create a new Bean instance inside this EntityBundle.

      NOTE: This method should be used with caution, as it does not respect the intended accessibility of the entity constructor. The preferred method of creating a new Bean is by using the entity constructor, if available, e.g.: 

       Activity activity = new Activity(bundle);
      If no entity constructor is available, then either the entity is abstract and can't be constructed anyway, or else the intended accessibility of the entity constructor is not public.
      Parameters:
      type - the EntityIntrinsicType of the Bean type to create
      requiredValues - values for the required fields of the entity
      Returns:
      a new Bean instance inside this bundle (e.g., this == newBean.getBundle())

    • loadBean

      KeyableBean loadBean(Key id)
      First looks in this bundle and returns the bean if it's found. If not, looks in the backing entity source and, if the bean is found, adds it to this bundle.
      Parameters:
      id - the id to load
      Returns:
      the loaded bean, or null if no bean with that id exists

    • loadBeanByPublicId

      KeyableBean loadBeanByPublicId(IEntityType type, String publicId)
      Loads the specified bean by PublicID. The bean will be loaded from this bundle if it's already present, including newly-inserted beans with reserved ids, and then will fall back to the backing entity source, generally the global cache and finally database. This method cannot be used with eff-dated entity types. Note: This method will not perform well on bundles that have a large number of beans already loaded for the requested type, as it has to iterate over every entity of that type. It should only be used on small and/or short-lived bundles that need to look elements up by PublicID because the references are coming from an external system, e.g. as part of an API call.
      Parameters:
      type - the IEntityType of the bean to load
      publicId - the PublicID of the bean to load
      Returns:
      the bean represented by the publicId or null if it doesn't exist

    • commit

      void commit() throws RuntimeException
      Commits this bundle to the database. This method will create a new transaction and commit the bundle to the database.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If a transaction already exists this will throw a TransactionException wrapped in a RuntimeException.

    • loadByKey

      @Deprecated KeyableBean loadByKey(Key key)
      Deprecated.
      Use loadBean(Key) instead.
      Loads bean for the specified key
      Parameters:
      key - the key to load
      Returns:
      the bean represented by the key or null if it doesn't exist

    • loadByPublicId

      @Deprecated KeyableBean loadByPublicId(IEntityType type, String publicId)
      Deprecated.
      Use a query to load a bean by PublicID instead, or use loadBeanByPublicId to load via the bundle and global cache
      Loads the specified bean by public ID
      Parameters:
      publicId - the PublicID of the bean
      Returns:
      the bean represented by the publicId or null if it doesn't exist

    • getInsertedBeans

      Collection<KeyableBean> getInsertedBeans()
      Gets the beans that have been created in this bundle.

    • getUpdatedBeans

      Collection<KeyableBean> getUpdatedBeans()
      Gets the beans that have been updated in this bundle. These are beans that exist in the database, but have been changed.

    • getRemovedBeans

      Collection<KeyableBean> getRemovedBeans()
      Gets the beans that have been removed in this bundle. These are beans that exist in the database, but will be removed (retired or deleted) when this bundle is committed.

    • isReadOnly

      boolean isReadOnly()
      Whether modifications can be made to beans in this bundle. Beans returned from finders are placed in a bundle that is read only.

    • addBundleTransactionCallback

      void addBundleTransactionCallback(BundleTransactionCallback callback)
      Adds callback to the list of callbacks to be executed when the containing bundle is committed. In particular see the steps described in the java doc for this type.

    • getBundleTransactionCallbacks

      List<BundleTransactionCallback> getBundleTransactionCallbacks()
      Returns the callbacks registered to run when the containing bundle is committed. May return null if no callbacks have been registered.

    • getBeansByRootType

      Collection<KeyableBean> getBeansByRootType(IEntityType eit)
      Returns all beans in the bundle of the given type

    • setValidationOption

      void setValidationOption(BundleValidationOption option)
      Sets the validation option to use when committing this bundle.

    • pushVersion

      BundleVersion pushVersion()
      Push a new version on all the beans in a bundle. Returns the version prior to the push. Rolling back to the version this method returns will return the bundle to exactly the state it was in when pushVersion was called.
      Returns:
      a version which, if passed to rollbackVersion, returns the bundle to exactly the state it was in before the call to this method.

    • rollbackVersion

      void rollbackVersion(BundleVersion version)
      Rolls back to a specified version. Use this to roll back to a version number returned by a specific call to pushVersion in order to return the bundle to the state it was in when that pushVersion call was made.
      Parameters:
      version - must be the result of a pushVersion call to this same bundle
